meanings.definition: A person who carries out a transaction.
meanings.sent1: The transactor handed over the money in exchange for the goods.
meanings.sent2: The bank clerk processed the transaction made by the transactor.
meanings.sent3: The transactor accidentally paid with Monopoly money, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled transactor, navigating deals with ease and precision.
meanings.sent5: The transactor's role was crucial in ensuring the smooth exchange of goods.

meanings.sent1: I will transact with the seller to purchase the item.
meanings.sent2: The business partners decided to transact online for convenience.
meanings.sent3: He transacted quickly, almost like a professional speed shopper.
meanings.sent4: The deal was transacted under the watchful eye of the auctioneer.
meanings.sent5: She transacted the trade with a firm handshake and a smile.
